Patterns

  • User login

Errors

Use error messages to let users know there is a problem and tell them how to fix it.

  1. Error summary
  2. Field error
  3. Button error

1. Error summary

Use the error summary at the top of form pages to highlight all errors on that page to the user once the user has clicked a button.

There's a problem

  1. Enter your surname
  2. Enter a valid email address
  3. Enter a valid postcode
HTML injected here
Angular example usage:

2. Field error

Use field errors to guide users to the field that has an error. Use these alongside error summaries, and also when using inline validation.

Enter a valid email address

HTML injected here
Angular example usage:
                
<app-textinput
    [isValid]="true"
    [inputText]="inputText"
    [validation]="inputFormControl"
    [invalidMessage]="'Email is invalid'"
>
</app-textinput>

3. Button error

Use button errors to let users know there's a problem after they've clicked a button.

There's a problem with the information you provided
HTML injected here
Angular example usage:
<app-button [label]="'Open folder'" [icon]="'fa-folder'" [isSecondary]="true" [onClick]="logClick" > </app-button>
